formattedAddress: 192 E 75th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 192 E 75th St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text: We love Smiles for Kids!! It’s like an old time family practice where your doctor knows you and there’s a real personal connection.  We have been going for years and would never go any place else.  Most importantly, the medical care is  bar none!

text.text: We love Smiles for Kids!! It’s like an old time family practice where your doctor knows you and there’s a real personal connection.  We have been going for years and would never go any place else.  Most importantly, the medical care is  bar none!

originalText.text: Dr Mark and his lovely staff were wonderful with my 7 year old daughters extraction. She was scared of dentists, but after the banana chair and the storybook room, she loves it and her teeth are all better!

text.text: Dr Mark and his lovely staff were wonderful with my 7 year old daughters extraction. She was scared of dentists, but after the banana chair and the storybook room, she loves it and her teeth are all better!

originalText.text: Two kids, three sets of braces, dozens of cleanings and we remain loyal. So happy to find a caring and professional dentist in our neighborhood.

text.text: Two kids, three sets of braces, dozens of cleanings and we remain loyal. So happy to find a caring and professional dentist in our neighborhood.

originalText.text:
I can't say enough about the fantastic experience we had with Smiles4Kids and Dr. Mark. Our child has sensory issues and has had terrible experiences with our previous pediatric dentist (they had us hold him on a board while he screamed). I thought he would have to be sedated.
Dr. Mark spoke with me as a parent to get details on my child, explained options, and said "I treat my patients the way I would treat my own children." He put me at ease - and then went on to create a delightful experience for my son.
Needless to say, no sedation was needed. My son was laughing in the chair and chatted with everyone on the staff afterward. He even asked when he was coming back!
Dr. Mark Hochberg & his staff are wonderful. All parts of the space are warm, inviting, and fun. They have changed my son's attitude about his teeth & about visiting the dentist. An amazing experience & wonderful dentist.

Needless to say, no sedation was needed. My son was laughing in the chair and chatted with everyone on the staff afterward. He even asked when he was coming back!
Dr. Mark Hochberg & his staff are wonderful. All parts of the space are warm, inviting, and fun. They have changed my son's attitude about his teeth & about visiting the dentist. An amazing experience & wonderful dentist.

originalText.text:
My daughter literally had THE best experience here! No exaggeration. It was her first true dentist’s experience at age 3.5. Not only was Doctor Mark and every single person that worked there so warm and kind, but they were genuinely experts in their roles. I felt so super confident with my daughter in their hands. And the place was fun! There are games and themed rooms and I just felt it was the perfect touch of orchestrated in that… yes, it was personal, informative and genuine… but all the fun stuff was so well organized and rehearsed that there was nothing uncomfy about the visit for Rosie. She left with a bag of toy goodies of various things in her favorite color and character… not limited to the typical toothbrush and tooth paste. She actually loves keeping up with her dental hygiene.

Doctor Mark is great - he spoke in a way that was informative and technical, but that Rosie and us as her parents def understood and put into practice at home.  Lastly, I mentioned all that worked there were great, but shout out to Andrea the hygienist… Rosie’s absolute fave! (Hasn’t stopped talking about her since.)

A 5-star experience for sure. We’ll be back for our second visit soon. (And we live in Queens!)
